DataElement.preferredName: Ophthalmology Slit-lamp Examination Clinically Significant Abnormal Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether the abnormal results from a person's ophthalmologic slit-lamp examination were clinically significant.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Ophthalmology Slit-lamp Examination Clinically Significant Abnormal
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Determination of the visual capabilities of a person by completion of an ophthalmologic examination of the anterior segment of the eye using a medical instrument called a slit lamp.evaluation._Examination of the anterior segment of the eye using a medical instrument called a slit lamp._Specifies whether a finding or condition is clinically significant based on judgment._Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
